introduction.p: General PCC Grading Guidelines are found at catalog.pcc.edu/handbook/g301-gradingguidelines.

paragraphs.title: Labs
paragraphs.p: Most class days, you will work in small groups on a collection of exercises from the PCC Calculus Lab Manual. Work on these diligently during class time with your partners, and then turn in a completed lab write-up. You and your partners might finish during class, but you may need to arrange to meet with each other after class. You need to complete each lab write-up before the next class meets.
If you miss class, you may complete the lab on your own and turn it in before the next class.
One grade will be assigned for each lab write-up. All group memebers share the grade. Each lab write-up is worth 2% of your final grade, for a total of 28%.

paragraphs.title: Online Homework
paragraphs.p: You have online homework for each section using . See for details. The due date for each assignment is posted in . It will always be Tuesday evening at 10:00pm. Usually, more than one section will be due at the same time. You should start working on a homework assignment soon after the class that is associated with that section of APEX.
Collectively, all the online homework is worth 6% of your final grade.

paragraphs.title: Quizzes
paragraphs.p: You have weekly quizzes using . Each homework assignment is due on a Tuesday evening. I will build a quiz that uses those homework questions for which there was the least overall success, but still appropriate for a 1-hour time limit. This is intended to motivate you to do all of the homework and ask questions when you do not understand something yet. You take these quizzes when you are able to, but they must be completed by Friday evening at 10:00pm. Each quiz is worth 2% and there are 8 quizzes, for a total of 16%.

paragraphs.title: Exams
paragraphs.p: The final exam will be Monday June 8. Hopefully it will be on campus, in our classroom TH 200, 9:0011:50. At this time we can't be sure. The final exam will be worth 25% of your grade.

There will also be a midterm exam. Because of the virus response, its format and location are not yet known. Tentatively, it will be an in-person exam in our classroom TH 200, 9:0011:50, on Wednesday May 6. The midterm will be worth 25% of your grade.
